newsitem.title: HONG KONG: PT Bank Dagang Negara closes US$95 mln FRN.
newsitem.headline: PT Bank Dagang Negara closes US$95 mln FRN.

text.p: A syndicate group has formed for PT Bank Dagang Negara's US$95 million floating rate notes issue due in 2003, the joint bookrunners said on Wednesday.
The seven-year notes were issued at par to float at 67 basis points over the six-month London Interbank Offered Rate. There is a put and a call option in year five.
Fees are 25 basis points split 10 basis points for management and underwriting and 15 basis points for selling concession.
Lead managers and joint bookrunners are Daiwa Securities (HK) and HSBC Markets.
JP Morgan Securities Asia is the senior co-lead manager. Co-lead managers are Deutsche Morgan Grenfell and Merrill Lynch International.
Co-managers are Asahi Finance (Hong Kong), Baden-Wurttembergische Bank, BZW, Chase Manhattan Asia, DKB Asia, IBJ Asia, Painewebber International and Sakura Merchant Bank Singapore.
The notes are free to trade at 5 p.m. Hong Kong time (0900 GMT). Signing is tentatively set for November 26. The payment date is December 3.
